definition: to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: It is effectively a way to overcome the limitation of single-inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 这是绕过单一继承限制的一个有效途径。

sentences.english: What BrainGate does is bypass the broken connection.
sentences.chinese: 而Braingate做的就是绕过损坏的连接。

sentences.english: The aim is to cut Sprint out of the loop.
sentences.chinese: 这么做的目的就是要绕过斯普林特公司。

sentences.english: The Zebrafish DVD Exchange Project is aimed at by-passing these limitations.
sentences.chinese: 斑马鱼DVD交换计划旨在绕过这些限制。

sentences.english: However you have evaded my argument.
sentences.chinese: 然而你绕过了我的论点。

sentences.english: The ship will double Cape Horn.
Mechanically I obeyed, turned eastwards, and with my cutlass raised, ran round the corner of the house.
sentences.chinese: 我机械地服从命令向东转，举着弯刀跑步绕过屋角。

sentences.english: In the control group, the sutures passed around the coronary artery but were not tied.
sentences.chinese: 在对照组，缝线绕过大鼠的冠状动脉但不结扎。

sentences.english: Circumventing the toolset is equivalent to challenging that person.
sentences.chinese: 绕过工具集等同于对那个人挑战。

sentences.english: Use the Ice Drill to bypass a large section of the GARM facility.
sentences.chinese: 利用冰钻绕过GARM设施的一大片区域。

sentences.english: Circling the traps, he positions himself in between his son and the bear trap.
sentences.chinese: 他绕过那些陷阱，用自己的身体把儿子和捕熊器隔开。

sentences.english: The police crept up from behind and took the gangster by surprise.
sentences.chinese: 警察悄悄从背后绕过去，出其不意地将歹徒逮捕。

sentences.english: He and his wife navigated their car around fallen trees and other debris to get to Kerri's home.
sentences.chinese: 他和妻子开车绕过倒下的树和其他杂物来到凯利的家。

sentences.english: Some of the king's wealthiest merchants and courtiers came by and simply walked around it.
sentences.chinese: 一些最有钱的商人和侍臣经过，他们只是绕过巨石。

definition: to cross over/to transcend/to cover distance/to overcome/to rise above
to go by a roundabout route/to take a detour/(medicine or civil engineering) bypass
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
variant of 繞|绕[rao4], to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
to march straight in unchallenged (military) (idiom)/(fig.) to push deep into the heart of sth/to flood in
